text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Philodox gift
The Philodox is able to scent the truth of those she meets, literally sniffing out an
individual’s true form. A vulture-spirit teaches this Gift.
-- System
The Garou can smell Kinfolk or a fellow werewolf automatically; pre-Change werewolves
smell like Kin. In all other cases, the player must roll Perception + Primal-Urge (difficulty
6). One success will identify a normal human or animal; two successes will detect a
vampire, changeling, demon, mummy, or Fera; three successes will detect a
human-seeming HIT Mark cyborg or similar infiltrator robot; four successes are needed to
sniff out a mage, ghoul, or fomor. The Imbued register as normal humans to this Gift.
Unfamiliar scents aren’t automatically recognized: A Philodox that has never
encountered any Rokea might not immediately recognize the scent she detects as
“wereshark.”

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Glass Walkers gift
The Garou may command the spirits of the simplest machines, causing levers to flip, doors
to unbolt, pulleys to roll and so on. Any technological spirit can teach this Gift.
-- System
The player spends a Willpower point and rolls Manipulation + Crafts (difficulty 7). The
Garou's control lasts until the end of the scene.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Homid gift
To creatures of the wild, man’s scent is death. To creatures of the city, it is authority,
comfort, easy meals. This Gift, taught by an ancestor-spirit, enhances a werewolf’s
human scent, infusing it with spiritual power.
-- System
Non-supernatural wild animals lose two dice from their dice pools when interacting with
the Garou, save when defending themselves or running away, and will be inclined to flee
rather than attack if possible. Domesticated animals recognize the werewolf as a friend,
and even trained attack dogs will do no more than wag their tails at the character
unless attacked first. This Gift’s effects are permanently active.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: WaWWoD Cross+Over Sheet 19.03 ©2024, Red Fox Studios.
